Date: Russia Advances Behind Brutal Barrage, but Will Its Strategy Keep Working?
Title: Russia’s capture of the cities of Sievierodonetsk and Lysychansk, a significant victory for Moscow’s campaign to conquer eastern Ukraine, demonstrates the success of the Russian military’s grinding strategy based on superior firepower and incremental advances.
Text: The Russian and Ukrainian armies have both been badly mauled, raising questions about how long they can keep fighting as they have, particularly the outgunned Ukrainians.

Date: Brittney Griner to Biden: ‘I’m Terrified I Might Be Here Forever’
Title: Brittney Griner, the W.N.B.A. star who has been detained in Russia on drug charges since February, sent a handwritten letter to President Biden on Monday asking him not to forget about her.
Text: Griner, the W.N.B.A. star, sent a letter to President Biden on Monday, asking him to help free her from prison in Russia. She has been in custody since February.

Date: When the Czarinas Ruled the Front Row
Title: Around this time just over a decade ago something happened in fashion that was as rare and unexpected as the sight of Kate Moss in a tutu.
Text: A group of Russian women were once the hottest things at couture, embraced not just by fashion, but by the watching world. Where are they now?

Date: ‘Get the Stretcher!’ Life and Death on Ukraine’s Front Line
Title: Between the cracks of mortar fire and the metallic bangs of Russian self-detonating mines, Yurii, a Ukrainian Army medic, readied an intravenous line for the soldier sprawled on the stretcher below him.
Text: On another day of scorched-earth artillery barrages in the east, a team of Ukrainian medics did their best to stabilize and assure the survivors, with the din of war all around.

Date: Quotation of the Day: Russia Advances in East, but Win Takes Harsh Toll
Title: “There is a problem with ammunition. For example, for our one shot, they would fire 50 shots. How can you fight this?”
Text: Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, July 5, 2022.

Date: Ukraine’s prime minister says rebuilding will cost $750 billion.
Title: For Ukrainians living through war, the cost of the conflict is hard to measure: Thousands of people killed, countless homes and buildings destroyed by missiles, families displaced, livelihoods lost. But international leaders are gathering in the lakeside Swiss town of Lugano for a second day on Tuesday in an attempt to do just that.
Text: World leaders are mapping out the monumental effort to restore a war-battered nation.

Date: Britain Gears Up for a Summer of Labor Discontent
Title: It was one of the more unusual public displays in a city long used to noisy and colorful demonstrations: protesters wearing flowing black gowns and curled horsehair wigs waving placards on Monday outside a London courthouse.
Text: With energy costs and inflation surging, and taxes and the cost of loans increasing, British workers are demanding higher pay and going on strike with a militancy not seen in years.

Date: Maryna Viazovska: Second to none in any dimension.
Title: Maryna Viazovska, a Ukrainian who is now a professor at the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Lausanne, is known for proofs for higher-dimensional equivalents of the stacking of equal- sized spheres. She is also only the second woman ever to win the Fields Medal.
Text: Dr. Viazovska works on a variation of a conjecture introduced 400 years ago by Johannes Kepler, and she is the second woman to win the Fields Medal.

Date: Can Fashion Still Shock?
Title: What’s shocking now?
Text: From trompe l’oeil to the metaverse, Schiaparelli, Dior and Iris van Herpen offer some answers.

Date: U.S. veterans are training Ukrainians near the front lines in the fight against Russia.
Title: A democracy came under attack. The United States saw a threat to an ally and also to the entire world order, but it feared that sending troops could incite a nuclear war. So, instead, it supplied weapons. And a small number of American Special Operations trainers started quietly working with the local military.

Date: Veterans of Carter-Era Inflation Warn That Biden Has Few Tools to Tame Prices
Title: When inflation surged in the late 1970s, President Jimmy Carter convened his top economic advisers for weekly lunch meetings in which they tended to offer overly optimistic forecasts of how high prices would rise.
Text: President Biden and Democrats face political peril as costs keep rising and midterm elections loom.

Date: A Poor Country Made Bitcoin a National Currency. The Bet Isn’t Paying Off.
Title: Bitcoin was meant to transform El Salvador’s economy, catapulting the poor Central American nation into an unlikely harbinger of a financial revolution.
Text: It brought El Salvador’s president, Nayib Bukele, the adulation of the tech community, but reduced scarce funds and moved the nation closer to default.

Date: U.S. Aims to Expand Export Bans on China Over Security and Human Rights
Title: When Russian forces invaded Ukraine nearly five months ago, the Biden administration led dozens of governments in banning the export of advanced technology to Russia to hobble its economic and military development.
Text: The Biden administration is applying lessons learned from controls on Russia during the Ukraine war to try to limit China’s military and technological advances.

Date: The euro hits a 20-year low and U.S. bonds flash a warning sign as economic fears mount.
Title: The euro fell to a 20-year low against the U.S. dollar on Tuesday, as fears about the European economy weighed heavily on the currency. It was one of several signs of renewed economic worries around the world, which were also reflected in stocks wobbling, bonds flashing warning signals and oil prices falling sharply.
Text: Oil prices tumbled and other markets around the world reflected renewed recession worries.

Date: As Russia Moves on Another Province, Ukrainians Leave Ghost Towns Behind
Title: Nina Zakharenko cried when she boarded a minibus evacuating civilians as the Russian Army advanced toward the town where she went to college, met her husband and raised two daughters.
Text: Vast stretches of eastern Ukraine are now largely devoid of people and industry. If Ukraine is ever to have a vibrant postwar future, it is unlikely to sprout from these ruins.

Title: Hello. This is your Russia-Ukraine War Briefing, a weeknight guide to the latest news and analysis about the conflict.
Text: Russia sets its sights on the next target in the Donbas.

Date: Corrections: July 6, 2022
Title: An article on Monday about American Special Operations veterans training Ukrainians near the front lines in the fight against Russia mischaracterized the group that helps evacuate Americans from Ukraine. It is a nonprofit organization, not a volunteer group.
Text: Corrections that appeared in print on Wednesday, July 6, 2022.

Date: How War in Ukraine Roiled Russia’s ‘Coolest Company’
Title: What a difference a war makes.
Text: The decline of Yandex, the Russian version of Google, is emblematic of the economic and cultural troubles spawned by the invasion.
